reviewText: I have seen this Western movie several times on the Encore Western Channel, and each time have enjoyed viewing it. Glenn Ford was his usual "at ease"with a six-shooter and @ the ready,also calm,cool & collected,one of "The Golden Years Of Hollywood Years",GREAT actors. Chad & Angie were acceptable & absolutely enjoyed seeing 'ol Charlie(Wagon Train),play his usual good mannered,but dumb character!'ya still gotta love this character actor :-)Overall I would rate this movie a B+ and recommend it to fans of the Western genre...

reviewText: The Last Challenge is another of Glen Ford's movies you'll truely enjoy watching.  Chad Everett is a young pistolero named Lot McGuire, who meets up with the older gun Marshal Dan Blaine (played by Glen Ford) on the open trail for a little relaxing conversation; a snort of whiskey; and some good fried fish.  What starts out as a friendly exchange of dialogue between the two men, abruptly comes to a screeching halt when the pistolero speaks of a man named Blaine he plans to challenge to a gunfight, only to find the man he wants to kill, is also the man he has been sitting face to face with the whole time.  Glen has a real liking for his young friend...and dreads the thought of having to kill him.  Angie Dickinson(Glen's girlfriend Lisa)fears the marshal is not up to the challenge; and tries to help him out in her own way.  Her interference only makes things worse!The Last Challenge is a top notch western...and a great addition to your video collection!

reviewText: The Last Challenge is a 1967 western starring Glenn Ford, Angie Dickinson and Chad Everett and was written into a screen play by Albert Maltz. Maltz was one of the Hollywood 10, a list of screenwriters who found themselves blacklisted in the 1950s by HUAC, the House Un-American Activities Committee. The plot is an old one - a young gunslinger Lot McGuire (Chad Everett) wants to challenge the experienced older veteran, Marshall Dan Blaine, played by Glenn Ford. Miss Lisa Denton (Angie Dickinson) is Blaine's love interest and the owner of the local "sporting house". Lot and Dan meet outside of town without an exchange of who they are, and a bond is forged. This theme appears throughout the movie, even tho' Lot is determined to go through with his challenge. Of course, as in every western the inevitable happens and Lot is killed in a high noon moment.(Poor Chad Everett,certainly a handsome dead young gunslinger). Marshall Blaine rides off into the sunset, saddened by his deed and Lisa Denton is left bereft. The Last Challenge was well acted, and although I thoroughly enjoyed it, it was not a great movie, but... I could be persuaded to watch it again!

reviewText: I am not usually a big Western fan but this one piqued my interest. Glenn Ford as the "old" gunfighter who just wants to be left alone, a very beautiful Angie Dickinson and the "lady" who loves him and along comes the young gun, Chad Everett (very handsome) to beat the top man and be the best. I'm glad we got to know all the characters before the gunfight. Needless to say the performances were fun and wait til you see a lot of the old Western actor staples. Very good and kept my attention.

reviewText: A great cast. A great storyline. Ex gunfighter turned lawman. Young gunfighter seeking a reputation. Don't be deceived by the horrible cover, Killer vs. Killer. Western fans will get everything they want & more from the storyline and acting. This was a sleeper. Glen Ford made some great westerns. Go online & look up his top 10 westerns. Get all of them thru this seller. I did.
